result.execSummary:
The defendant Amanda R Kau was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at a rate of $25.00 per month commencing 12/15/15 (w/payment plan fee of $15.00) Alternate 8 days jail.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amanda R Kau

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Order for Reimbursement of Attorney Fees.
  Signed by Judge Aprahamian on 11/23/15.
Affidavit for Services Rendered filed by Atty Powers.
Treatment letter filed.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Amanda R Kau in court with attorney Mark P. Powers.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 2.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count #1 is dismissed and read in.  The Defendant was sentenced as follows: FINE $379.00 to be paid at $25.00 per month commencing 12/15/15 or serve 8 days jail consecutive, as penalty for failure to pay.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
Hearing at 10-26-2015 02:00 pm
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.

Attorney Mark P. Powers in court.   Defendant Amanda R Kau did not appear.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization. WCS letter addressed. Defense has spoken to ADA Dewire and DA Boese and needs time to speak to his client. Defense requests another date. Court will give a date in 30 days. Defense to advise on the next date how they will proceed.  Hearing scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Hearing on September 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Attorney appears by authorization
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.

Attorney Mark P. Powers in court.   Defendant Amanda R Kau did not appear.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. WCS letter addressed.  Attorney appears by authorization. Defense requests another date. Court grants request. Defense to advise the court on the next date how this matter will proceed - plea or trial.  Hearing scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing on August 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.

Defendant Amanda R Kau in court with attorney Mark P. Powers.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. WCS letter addressed. Defense requests another date. State just handed over discovery to Defense. Defense has no offer. State to provide an offer to Defense in one week. Court will give a date in 30 days.  Hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on July 22, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Defendant to pay: $25.00 per month commencing 7/15/15.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Hearing on July 22, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.   Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant to not discuss the case with any witness named in the criminal complaint.     Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program.

Defendant Amanda R Kau in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. Defendant has filled out the Application for Court Appointed Attorney. Court orders payment plan of $25.00 per month commencing July 15, 2015.  Hearing scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 09:00 am.
